document.docTitle: Pungalina albobarbata L. Koch 1879, comb. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: New genera, new species and redescriptions of Australian jumping spiders (Araneae: Salticidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New genera, new species and redescriptions of Australian jumping spiders (Araneae: Salticidae)

figureCitation.captionText-0: FIGURES 150 – 157. Pungalina albobarbata comb. nov. 150 – 153 male (150 dorsal view, 151 lateral view, 152 ventral view, 153 anterior view); 154 – 157 female (154 dorsal view, 155 lateral view, 156 ventral view, 157 anterior view). Scale: 1 mm
figureCitation.captionText-1: FIGURES 158 – 166. Pungalina albobarbata comb. nov. 158 – 160 left male palp (158 prolateral view, 159 ventral view, 160 retrolateral view); 161 – 162 left male palp, syntypes (M. Żabka, pers. com.) (161 ventral view, 162 retrolateral view); 163 – 165 female genitalia, syntypes (M. Żabka, pers. com.) (163 ventral view, 164 dorsal view); 165 female genitalia, ventral view); 166 map showing known (red) and predicted (gray) distributions. Scale: palp 0.5 mm, epigyne 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Icius albobarbatus L. Koch, 1879
, 1138, pl. 99 , figs 2, 3.

Remarks. Detailed descriptions of the types can be found in
Koch ( 1879 )
and in
Żabka ( 1987 )
. The syntypes are part of the collection in ZMUH and can no longer be borrowed, making work on this very extensive collection of Australian types difficult for Australian workers. Fortunately, Prof. M. Żabka has seen and drawn one of the male syntypes and kindly made his original illustrations available (Żabka pers. com.). As there is no confusion as to the specific identification of the syntypes and they have not been seen, no lectotype has been designated.

Material examined. Syntype .
Drawings provided by M. Żabka: F, Sydney
151.22 °E
,
33.88 °S
( ZMUH MG 16534 ).

Diagnosis: The females (
Figs 163–165
) can be separated from
P. semiatra L. Koch
(
Figs 193–197
) by the distal rather than lateral direction taken by the insemination ducts and the possession of large rather than small atria. It can be separated from
P. plurilineata
sp. nov.
(
Figs 178– 180
) by the much smaller fertilization ducts in P.

albobarbata
and the long lateral rather than shorter median guides. The males can be separated from the other two species by the shapes and sizes of the proximal lobes on the tegula and the different shapes of the tibial apophyses and emboli.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 150–157.
Pungalina albobarbata
comb. nov.
150–153 male (150 dorsal view, 151 lateral view, 152 ventral view, 153 anterior view); 154–157 female (154 dorsal view, 155 lateral view, 156 ventral view, 157 anterior view). Scale: 1 mm

FIGURES 158–166.
Pungalina albobarbata
comb. nov.
158–160 left male palp (158 prolateral view, 159 ventral view, 160 retrolateral view); 161–162 left male palp, syntypes (M. Żabka, pers. com.) (161 ventral view, 162 retrolateral view); 163–165 female genitalia, syntypes (M. Żabka, pers. com.) (163 ventral view, 164 dorsal view); 165 female genitalia, ventral view); 166 map showing known (red) and predicted (gray) distributions. Scale: palp 0.5 mm, epigyne 0.1 mm.
